title: Updated sl (Slovenian) translation
body: Commit made via [Stringlate](https://lonamiwebs.github.io/stringlate/)

title: move czech translation and bump version
body: you should tag 2.1 after merging

title: Update LICENSE
body: I want to republish this please let me learn from you.

title: Clean code
body: Deleted unused methods.

title: reorganize project setup, and maintenance
body:
could you fix the submodule reference (if you merge this) please? i dont know how to
(set it to the latest commit, which is this)
https://github.com/uberspot/2048/commit/7986ea0432fc9fd6634dfeaff3b966ecb7aa78de

title: Fix: Gradle sync failed in android studio 3.2
body:
In android studio 3.2  this project has an error: Gradle sync failed. as #65
so I update gradle plugin fix it

title: Gradle sync failed: No toolchains found in the NDK toolchains folder for ABI with prefix: mipsel-linux-android
body:
In my new install android studio, I can't build success, it said:
No toolchains found in the NDK toolchains folder for ABI with prefix: mipsel-linux-android

title: Tag new version
body: Can you tag a new version, so the screenshots make it to F-Droid?

title: Webpage not availbale
body:
when i try to see the app on my phone before i do any change, i get an error 

"Webpage not available 
The webpage at
file:///android_asset/2048/index.html?lang=en could not be loaded because:
net::ERR_FILE_NOT_FOUND

title: Hide virtual nav bar in full screen mode
label: [Label(name="good first issue")]

title: Better Scaling
label: [Label(name="good first issue")]
body:
Here is what 2048 looks like on my screen. I could live with this if at least the touch detection was fullscreen.

![](https://i.imgur.com/eJHkwLZ.png)

title: index.html file is not found!
body: The APP does not work because the file `index.html` is not found.

title: Fixed h2 titles.
body: Added a space in README.md to format correctly h2 titles on github main page.

title: Need Suggestion
body: If i will use your code along with some minor changes. Then will i be able to distribute it legally in playstore if i will mention your name in the description of playstore. (As you have licensed your code under MIT License).

title: Suspicion of copyright violation
body:
Hi @uberspot 

I found [this app ](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.appwala.a2048) and also [this one](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.manisware.a2048) on Google Play Store. It seems that this apps are just the sames as your own app. This guys just took the source code, added some ads and put it on the Google Play Store...

As you are the owner of the source code, feel free to open a request to google [here](https://support.google.com/legal/contact/lr_dmca?product=googleplay) to remove each false app from the Store, if it's your wish ;)

Don't forget to tell Google that:

* The app is licensed under MIT and this guy is violating it by distributing the app warning this is MIT licensed;
* He is falsely claiming he made the app;
* Also tell them that this guy has done the same thing already with other apps. Probably this is worth mentioning. (I watch him)

title: Update README.md
body:
Hi,

This is a very small PR that adds a button to get the app on F-Droid, and improve the link to the Google Play Store with a button.

Thanks for your app :)

title: move app store files into fdroid/fastlane standard dirs
body:
As of F-Droid v0.103, it can show feature graphics, screenshots, and localized text.  This allows fdroid to automatically include those for this app.  For more info:
https://f-droid.org/docs/All_About_Descriptions_Graphics_and_Screenshots

title: Enable 180° rotation
body: I sometimes like to rotate my phone 180° because the charger cable is annoying me. It would be nice if the game would rotate as well. It's so hard to play upside down. ;-)

title: Savegame?
label: [Label(name="good first issue")]
body:
Hello everybody,

I just updated my Android system and the actual score of the 2048 was dropped, i.e. the game starts at the beginning.
Does the game have some kind of a savegame functionality somewhere?

title: Larger font (from accessibility options) looks awful
body:
I have bad eyesight, so I use the larger font feature provided by the accessibility options on my phone. However, the tile numbers hang too low in this case, and the lower part of the number is cropped. I'd supply a screenshot if I knew how to take one on a phone.

I'm on Android 7.1.2. The settings are:

* Font size: largest
* Display size: large

title: Add language parameter in load webview with game
body:
Add language parameter in load webview with game.
GET parameter "lang" is based on current Android system Locale language.

title: Add language parameter in load webview with game
body:
Add language parameter in load webview with game.
GET parameter "lang" is based on current Android system Locale language.

title: Spurious line breaks push content off-screen
label: [Label(name="good first issue")]
body:
I'm using an Xperia Z2 and latest version from F-Droid. The screenshot speaks for itself:
![screenshot_2017-01-03-03-19-33](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/54771/21597927/8693ae10-d14a-11e6-8629-4de0d9c07117.png)

title: Updated strings.xml of values-de
body: Fixed a grammatical error

title: index.html missing
body:
Hey,

the index.html file appears to be missing form the assets/2048 directory.

title: Documented 2 methods
body: Documented the methods applyFullScreen() and onBackPressed in MainActivity.java

title: Update README to include explicit instructions for using Android Studio.
body: It took me a minute to figure out exactly what to do.  So maybe this would be a helpful update for people joining the project.

title: file:///android_asset/2048/index.html issue
body:
I downloaded the zip (yes, I extracted the zip file) from github to insert into android studio to check out / reverse engineer the code.

When I build to my phone, i get the error:  "file:///android_asset/2048/index.html is missing"
.
I guess I'm baffled as to why this is popping up, what am I missing?

I have included a screenshot of the build in android studio.

![2048screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10538543/14973037/e2e9126c-10a8-11e6-94a7-2b21bdfa799e.PNG)

title: Tapping on "undo" after "new game" produces three buttons
body:
If you tap on "undo", a screen with two buttons ("undo", "cancel") appears. And normally, if you tap on "new game", a screen with also two buttons ("ok", "cancel") appears.

But if you tap on "undo", don't dismiss the screen and tap additionally on "new game", there are three buttons: "undo", "ok" and "cancel". I'd expect the two buttons from one screen to be replaced by the two buttons from the other screen.

The three buttons' actions do work as intended.

title: Looks like a hang, work around by UNDO
body:
I reached more than 102400 points and still have open spaces. Highest piece is 8192.
The situation is as follows:
Whenever I make a move it won't show up. Further input is impossible (at least it looks like).
I use the UNDO to revert my move, then the previous situation gets shown. Then I can make ONE more move and I have to go through the UNDO loop again. Very annoying.
When starting the app I see a score of 0 and a high score of 0. When using the UNDO my current game board is shown again and I can start with ONE move.

System: Wiko Cink Peax 2, Android 4.1.2 (kernel 3.4.5, build ALPS.JB.SP.V1)

title: Suggest: Detect swipe play in white area outside of game grid. (Big screen, small thumbs)
label: [Label(name="good first issue")]
body:
It would be so wonderful if I could 2048 from the convenience and comfort of my screen edges -- the bottom, left and right sides outside of the game grid.  My thumbs are tiny compared to my 10.1 or 12 inch display, and it's difficult to see through my fingers.

Playable edges, please :)

title: Undo feature
body:
Hello

I added an undo feature to the 2048 game, now users are able to undo from a given state until the original start state of the game.

-- Santhosh

title: Too easy to accidentally press restart when 2048 is reached.
body:
Numerous times now I've gotten to 2048 and simply kept playing, and if I happen to be unfortunate enough to swipe on the right side of the screen, the game restarts. This is very frustrating. Part of the problem is that the animation takes a (relatively) long time, which is nice for the effect the first time there, and IMO annoying thereafter. I see two easy solutions:
- Don't initiate a button press if the press would normally be determined a swipe
- Add a configuration option to disable the victory screen.

title: 2048 level You Win mention
body:
What's the use of this tab at all ???
Everybody wants to go further and pushing the wrong button resets the game again, grrrr.

title: Assets folder is empty..
body: I get an error that index.html is not found in assets folder...is anyone else facing this issue?

title: What version of the Android SDK does it need?
body: And what else environment do I need to setup?

title: Does not work
body: ![screen shot 2015-08-03 at 12 43 03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12852413/9046141/8ac35b30-39dd-11e5-8221-dc01aea2735f.png)

title: Slow
body: Was thrilled when I found a free and open source version of this game, but it is just unplayable. It is incredibly laggy which boggles the mind as the graphics are rudimentary. My phone is a galaxy S6. Hope it can be improved.

title: Does not fit on small screen
body: The game works perfectly on my S3, but on the Samsung Pocket it's impossible to see the last row. I couldn't find a way to reduce zoom either.

title: Crash when game over
body:
When I lose, an advise is showed to let me play a new game or not doing it.
In the past version, I've pushed not doing it because that way, I could make a screenshot but now, it just crashes.

title: changelog
body:
Please add a change log, for example i would like to know what has changed between version 1.90 and 1.91 and between version 1.91And 1.95.

Thanks ang greatings. I am using fdroid:

2048 (Puzzle game) - https://f-droid.org/app/com.uberspot.a2048

title: Add Spanish translation
body: Spanish translation. I was not sure about how to translate the html of the game itself (I mean, I can translate that file, but I suppose something has to be made to the code so the game picks up the corresponding html according to the language). If you provide hints about that, I can translate the whole game here in the Android port or upstream.

title: Dark, please, late night play
body: 2048 is unpleasantly bright even with dimmest setting on my budget tablet

title: set minSdkVersion="8" (Android 2.2)
body:
set minSdkVersion="8" (Android 2.2)
and make it ready for Eclipse ADT or Gradle build

title: Added french translation for the android part
body: If you plan to add the possibility to translate the web app, please send me an e-mail.

title: tiles for 4096 and 8192 are black
body: this is probably an issue for https://github.com/uberspot/2048 but it has no issue tracker

title: Problem about sound
body: I added some sound to the game by using “ var audio = new Audio("./sound/sound.wav"); audio.play(); ” in js file. It works well in html, but not in the android application. I can't hear any sound in both android phone and android simulator. Please tell me how to make it right. PS: I'm not good at android programming.

title: Cannot find index.html
body:
This is all I get on my phone: Web page not available "file:///android_asset/2048/index.html"

I don't know whether this is caused by the game itself or because I do not have the default Google browser on my phone ("only" Lightning Browser and Opera).

title: F-Droid build won't start
body:
Hi. I've just installed the apk from F-Droid. On clicking the icon a standard Android "website unavailable" screen shows, claiming that the "web" [sic] file:///android_asset/2048/index.html might be temporarily out of service or has moved.

This is on a Xperia ST21i with Android 4.04.
